intro: Epilobium pseudo-obscurum, commonly known as the dark willow herb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as stream banks and wet meadows. Epilobium pseudo-obscurum is often found in the Pacific Northwest and is adapted to thrive in cool, humid environments.
